db:abstract.db:para: The QToolBar class provides a movable panel that contains a set of controls.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: Toolbar buttons are added by adding actions, using addAction() or insertAction(). Groups of buttons can be separated using addSeparator() or insertSeparator(). If a toolbar button is not appropriate, a widget can be inserted instead using addWidget() or insertWidget(). Examples of suitable widgets are QSpinBox, QDoubleSpinBox, and QComboBox. When a toolbar button is pressed, it emits the actionTriggered() signal.
A toolbar can be fixed in place in a particular area (e.g., at the top of the window), or it can be movable between toolbar areas; see setMovable(), isMovable(), allowedAreas() and isAreaAllowed().

When a toolbar is resized in such a way that it is too small to show all the items it contains, an extension button will appear as the last item in the toolbar. Pressing the extension button will pop up a menu containing the items that do not currently fit in the toolbar.

When a QToolBar is not a child of a QMainWindow, it loses the ability to populate the extension pop up with widgets added to the toolbar using addWidget(). Please use widget actions created by inheriting QWidgetAction and implementing QWidgetAction::createWidget() instead.

db:section.db:title: allowedAreas : Qt::ToolBarAreas
db:section.db:para: areas where the toolbar may be placed
The default is Qt::AllToolBarAreas.
This property only makes sense if the toolbar is in a QMainWindow.

db:section.db:title: floatable : bool
db:section.db:para: This property holds whether the toolbar can be dragged and dropped as an independent window.
The default is true.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] floating : const bool
db:section.db:para: This property holds whether the toolbar is an independent window.
By default, this property is true.

db:section.db:title: iconSize : QSize
db:section.db:para: size of icons in the toolbar.

The default size is determined by the application's style and is derived from the QStyle::PM_ToolBarIconSize pixel metric. It is the maximum size an icon can have. Icons of smaller size will not be scaled up.

db:section.db:title: movable : bool
db:section.db:para: This property holds whether the user can move the toolbar within the toolbar area, or between toolbar areas.
By default, this property is true.
This property only makes sense if the toolbar is in a QMainWindow.

db:section.db:title: orientation : Qt::Orientation
db:section.db:para: orientation of the toolbar
The default is Qt::Horizontal.

This function should not be used when the toolbar is managed by QMainWindow. You can use QMainWindow::addToolBar() or QMainWindow::insertToolBar() if you wish to move a toolbar that is already added to a main window to another Qt::ToolBarArea.

db:section.db:title: toolButtonStyle : Qt::ToolButtonStyle
db:section.db:para: This property holds the style of toolbar buttons
This property defines the style of all tool buttons that are added as QActions. Note that if you add a QToolButton with the addWidget() method, it will not get this button style.

To have the style of toolbuttons follow the system settings, set this property to Qt::ToolButtonFollowStyle. On Unix, the user settings from the desktop environment will be used. On other platforms, Qt::ToolButtonFollowStyle means icon only.
The default is Qt::ToolButtonIconOnly.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QToolBar::QToolBar(const QString &title, QWidget *parent = nullptr)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a QToolBar with the given parent.
The given window title identifies the toolbar and is shown in the context menu provided by QMainWindow.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QToolBar::QToolBar(QWidget *parent = nullptr)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a QToolBar with the given parent.

db:section.db:title: [virtual] QToolBar::~QToolBar()
db:section.db:para: Destroys the toolbar.

db:section.db:title: QAction *QToolBar::actionAt(const QPoint &p) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the action at point p. This function returns zero if no action was found.

db:section.db:title: QAction *QToolBar::actionAt(int x, int y) const

db:methodsynopsis.db:synopsisinfo: QAction * actionAt(int x, int y) const

db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns the action at the point x, y. This function returns zero if no action was found.

db:section.db:title: [override virtual protected] void QToolBar::actionEvent(QActionEvent *event)
db:section.db:para: Reimplements: QWidget::actionEvent(QActionEvent *event).

db:section.db:title: void QToolBar::actionTriggered(QAction *action)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when an action in this toolbar is triggered. This happens when the action's tool button is pressed, or when the action is triggered in some other way outside the toolbar. The parameter holds the triggered action.

db:section.db:title: QAction *QToolBar::addAction(const QString &text)
db:section.db:para: Creates a new action with the given text. This action is added to the end of the toolbar.

db:section.db:title: QAction *QToolBar::addAction(const QIcon &icon, const QString &text)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Creates a new action with the given icon and text. This action is added to the end of the toolbar.

db:section.db:title: QAction *QToolBar::addAction(const QString &text, const QObject *receiver, const char *member)

db:methodsynopsis.db:synopsisinfo: QAction * addAction(const QString &text, const QObject *receiver, const char *member)

db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Creates a new action with the given text. This action is added to the end of the toolbar. The action's triggered() signal is connected to member in receiver.

db:section.db:title: QAction *QToolBar::addAction(const QIcon &icon, const QString &text, const QObject *receiver, const char *member)

db:methodsynopsis.db:synopsisinfo: QAction * addAction(const QIcon &icon, const QString &text, const QObject *receiver, const char *member)

db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Creates a new action with the given icon and text. This action is added to the end of the toolbar. The action's triggered() signal is connected to member in receiver.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.6] QAction *QToolBar::addAction(const QString &text, Functor functor)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Creates a new action with the given text. This action is added to the end of the toolbar. The action's triggered() signal is connected to the functor.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.6.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.6] QAction *QToolBar::addAction(const QString &text, const QObject *context, Functor functor)

db:methodsynopsis.db:synopsisinfo: QAction * addAction(const QString &text, const QObject *context, Functor functor)

db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.

Creates a new action with the given text. This action is added to the end of the toolbar. The action's triggered() signal is connected to the functor. The functor can be a pointer to a member function in the context object.
If the context object is destroyed, the functor will not be called.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.6.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.6] QAction *QToolBar::addAction(const QIcon &icon, const QString &text, Functor functor)

db:methodsynopsis.db:synopsisinfo: QAction * addAction(const QIcon &icon, const QString &text, Functor functor)

db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Creates a new action with the given icon and text. This action is added to the end of the toolbar. The action's triggered() signal is connected to the functor.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.6.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.6] QAction *QToolBar::addAction(const QIcon &icon, const QString &text, const QObject *context, Functor functor)

db:methodsynopsis.db:synopsisinfo: QAction * addAction(const QIcon &icon, const QString &text, const QObject *context, Functor functor)

db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.

Creates a new action with the given icon and text. This action is added to the end of the toolbar. The action's triggered() signal is connected to the functor. The functor can be a pointer to a member function of the context object.
If the context object is destroyed, the functor will not be called.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.6.

db:section.db:title: QAction *QToolBar::addSeparator()
db:section.db:para: Adds a separator to the end of the toolbar.

db:section.db:title: QAction *QToolBar::addWidget(QWidget *widget)
db:section.db:para: Adds the given widget to the toolbar as the toolbar's last item.
The toolbar takes ownership of widget.
If you add a QToolButton with this method, the toolbar's Qt::ToolButtonStyle will not be respected.

db:note.db:para: You should use QAction::setVisible() to change the visibility of the widget. Using QWidget::setVisible(), QWidget::show() and QWidget::hide() does not work.

db:section.db:title: void QToolBar::allowedAreasChanged(Qt::ToolBarAreas allowedAreas)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when the collection of allowed areas for the toolbar is changed. The new areas in which the toolbar can be positioned are specified by allowedAreas.

db:section.db:title: [override virtual protected] void QToolBar::changeEvent(QEvent *event)
db:section.db:para: Reimplements: QWidget::changeEvent(QEvent *event).

db:section.db:title: void QToolBar::clear()
db:section.db:para: Removes all actions from the toolbar.

db:section.db:title: [override virtual protected] bool QToolBar::event(QEvent *event)
db:section.db:para: Reimplements: QWidget::event(QEvent *event).

db:section.db:title: void QToolBar::iconSizeChanged(const QSize &iconSize)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when the icon size is changed. The iconSize parameter holds the toolbar's new icon size.

db:section.db:title: QAction *QToolBar::insertSeparator(QAction *before)
db:section.db:para: Inserts a separator into the toolbar in front of the toolbar item associated with the before action.

db:section.db:title: QAction *QToolBar::insertWidget(QAction *before, QWidget *widget)
db:section.db:para: Inserts the given widget in front of the toolbar item associated with the before action.
Note: You should use QAction::setVisible() to change the visibility of the widget. Using QWidget::setVisible(), QWidget::show() and QWidget::hide() does not work.

db:section.db:title: bool QToolBar::isAreaAllowed(Qt::ToolBarArea area) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if this toolbar is dockable in the given area; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: void QToolBar::movableChanged(bool movable)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when the toolbar becomes movable or fixed. If the toolbar can be moved, movable is true; otherwise it is false.

db:section.db:title: void QToolBar::orientationChanged(Qt::Orientation orientation)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when the orientation of the toolbar changes. The orientation parameter holds the toolbar's new orientation.

db:section.db:title: [override virtual protected] void QToolBar::paintEvent(QPaintEvent *event)
db:section.db:para: Reimplements: QWidget::paintEvent(QPaintEvent *event).

db:section.db:title: QAction *QToolBar::toggleViewAction() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a checkable action that can be used to show or hide this toolbar.
The action's text is set to the toolbar's window title.

db:section.db:title: void QToolBar::toolButtonStyleChanged(Qt::ToolButtonStyle toolButtonStyle)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when the tool button style is changed. The toolButtonStyle parameter holds the toolbar's new tool button style.

db:section.db:title: void QToolBar::topLevelChanged(bool topLevel)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when the floating property changes. The topLevel parameter is true if the toolbar is now floating; otherwise it is false.

db:section.db:title: void QToolBar::visibilityChanged(bool visible)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when the toolbar becomes visible (or invisible). This happens when the widget is hidden or shown.

db:section.db:title: QWidget *QToolBar::widgetForAction(QAction *action) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the widget associated with the specified action.
